Personally I'm quite happy with the blue-underline mechanism in "recent conversations" for the cursor and would be happy to just copy that for the inbox view (and then perhaps iterate on that design for both of them together).

I'd like the underline mechanism better with a more robust Tab implementation. Which is a longer way of saying that a line-highlight like the inbox view doesn't dash any hopes about where you can move focus to.

The inbox view (and, for that matter, the recent conversations view) shouldn’t use its own SimpleBar. It should use the HTML scrollbar just like the messages view does.

A particular bug I noticed with the inbox view scrollbar: if you scroll down, and then resize the browser window vertically just enough that the scrollbar disappears, it becomes impossible to scroll back up.
The .simplebar-content element belongs to the SimpleBar implementation, not us, and it looks like setting margin-bottom: var(--max-unexpanded-compose-height) on it is breaking the implementation.
